labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on creating visual representations from HTML content, specifically data visualizations such as charts. It leverages Chart.js for rendering and TailwindCSS for styling, ensuring responsive and well-centered images. The server also provides functionality to store and summarize notes, which suggests an additional productivity component. The custom URI scheme for note access indicates the server is designed for easy and frequent user interaction.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Data Analysis & Processing" is chosen because the server's main functionality revolves around creating visual data representations (e.g., charts from HTML content). The secondary label "Daily Productivity" is included due to the note-storing and summarization capabilities. The custom label "HTML-to-Image Conversion" is added to specifically describe the unique feature of converting HTML with Chart.js and TailwindCSS into images.

tools.name: generate_image_from_html
tools.description:
使用此工具在报告中插入数据可视化图表；此工具可以将 HTML 内容渲染为图片，并保存到固定位置。
    要求：使用 chart.js 绘制图表；引入 tailwindcss 编写样式；一定确保图表填充整个 html 尺寸并且垂直和水平居中；需要设置合理的 Y 轴范围，使得图表不会出现太大面积空白；

    Args:
        width: 图片宽度（像素）
        height: 图片高度（像素）
        html_content: 要渲染的 HTML 内容
        filename: 图片文件名

    Returns:
        操作结果信息

server_info_crawled.name: Generate Image from HTML
server_info_crawled.author: @sdaaron/generate_image_from_html_3
server_info_crawled.overview: Create images from HTML content effortlessly. Store and summarize notes with a simple interface, enhancing your productivity and organization. Utilize a custom URI scheme for easy access to your notes.

tools.name: generate_image_from_html
tools.description:
使用此工具在报告中插入数据可视化图表；此工具可以将 HTML 内容渲染为图片，并保存到固定位置。
    要求：使用 chart.js 绘制图表；引入 tailwindcss 编写样式；一定确保图表填充整个 html 尺寸并且垂直和水平居中；需要设置合理的 Y 轴范围，使得图表不会出现太大面积空白；

    Args:
        width: 图片宽度（像素）
        height: 图片高度（像素）
        html_content: 要渲染的 HTML 内容
        filename: 图片文件名

    Returns:
        操作结果信息

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@sdaaron/generate_image_from_html_3/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
